Class Player

java.lang.Object
game.Player
public class Player extends Object
Represents a player in the chess game. Tracks the player's color and available pieces.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Player(String color)
    Constructs a new player with the specified color.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String color)
      Constructs a new player with the specified color.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the player ("white" or "black").

  • Method Details

    • getColor

      public String getColor()
      Gets the color of this player.
      Returns:
      The player's color ("white" or "black").

    • getAvailablePieces

      public List<Piece> getAvailablePieces()
      Gets the list of available pieces for this player.
      Returns:
      A list of pieces that are still on the board.

    • getCapturedPieces

      public List<Piece> getCapturedPieces()
      Gets the list of captured pieces from the opponent.
      Returns:
      A list of pieces that this player has captured.

    • addPiece

      public void addPiece(Piece piece)
      Adds a piece to the player's available pieces.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to add.

    • removePiece

      public void removePiece(Piece piece)
      Removes a piece from the player's available pieces (when captured).
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to remove.

    • addCapturedPiece

      public void addCapturedPiece(Piece piece)
      Adds a captured piece to the player's captured pieces list.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece that was captured.

    • getAvailablePieceCount

      public int getAvailablePieceCount()
      Gets the number of available pieces.
      Returns:
      The count of pieces still on the board.

    • getCapturedPieceCount

      public int getCapturedPieceCount()
      Gets the number of captured pieces.
      Returns:
      The count of captured pieces.

    • hasAvailablePieces

      public boolean hasAvailablePieces()
      Checks if the player has any available pieces.
      Returns:
      true if the player has pieces on the board, false otherwise.

    • updateAvailablePieces

      public void updateAvailablePieces(Piece[][] board)
      Updates the available pieces list based on the current board state. This method should be called after each move to keep the list current.
      Parameters:
      board - The current board state.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this player.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representing the player.
